course_description: This comprehensive beginner-level course provides a practical foundation in Python programming for absolute newcomers. Students will master core programming concepts through hands-on exercises, building real-world applications while learning industry best practices. The curriculum covers syntax fundamentals, problem-solving techniques, and debugging strategies essential for launching a technical career. Participants gain confidence in writing efficient code and develop transferable skills applicable to data analysis, web development, and automation projects. Includes interactive coding challenges, peer-reviewed assignments, and instructor feedback to solidify understanding of computational thinking principles.
course_overview: This structured 5-module course begins with environment setup and 'Hello World' implementation, progressing systematically through foundational concepts. Module 1 covers variables and data types through practical exercises like building a currency converter that calculates exchange rates. Module 2 explores control structures via interactive projects including a quiz application with scoring logic and a temperature converter using conditional statements. Module 3 develops function-writing skills by creating reusable tools such as a math operations library and text analysis utilities. Module 4 implements file handling through real-world tasks like processing sales data CSV files to generate revenue reports. Module 5 introduces error handling and debugging with hands-on scenarios fixing broken code in a password validation system. Each module features bite-sized video lessons, automated coding exercises with instant feedback, and milestone projects culminating in a final capstone where students build a contact management system with search functionality. The curriculum emphasizes readable code practices, version control basics with Git, and preparation for industry-standard development workflows.
target_audience: Absolute beginners including career changers transitioning into tech roles, high school students preparing for AP Computer Science, marketing professionals automating report generation, finance analysts processing spreadsheet data, and non-technical entrepreneurs developing MVP prototypes. Specifically designed for learners with no prior coding experience but basic computer literacy who seek structured, project-based instruction to overcome initial programming hurdles.
prerequisites: Basic computer operation skills (file management, web browsing)
learning_outcomes: Define and implement core programming constructs including variables, data types, and operators in Python scripts
Construct conditional statements and loop structures to solve computational problems like grade calculators
Create modular functions with parameters and return values for reusable code components
Implement file input/output operations to process structured data from text files
Debug syntax and logical errors using print statements and IDE debugging tools
Build a command-line application that processes user input and generates formatted output
